openbar: ^Oh wow it's really packed here today.
^At least I managed to convince one of Jo's men to deal with things outside while I talk to people here.
^Now I Should ask Bernard more about his leads.
Bernard: ^Oh, hello there. Did you make up your mind?

s: ^First I need to know more about what you know

c-1: ^I'm afraid I haven't made as much progress as I would've liked...

g-1: ^I can tell you how I got hired.
^I myself only got on the case a few days ago. Some of the parents of these missing kids pitched in with the money to hire me.

^It's been two weeks since they've been gone. They went to the police, the guys looked around at first but... These kids weren't exactly role models. They got into some trouble themselves, and really liked this punk music. Not that that's an indicative of character, but it helps to paint a picture.
^Anyway, even though I said kids, they were actually over 18, so the officers didn't care that much and ended up just going with the runaway narrative.
g-2: ^Indeed. They said the kid's were not acting like themselves. Something iffy was going on. So they looked up some PIs, found out how I specialize in the supernatural...

^And here we are. All I could gather so far is what I already told you: the kids were around here in the bar a lot and it didn't take me long to find out this is a vampire spot... Has anyone ever told you guys are not exactly discreet?

c-3: ^Except now you believe one you is also missing.

g-3: ^Now it's your turn to tell me what you know.

s: ^Wait a moment, I still have some questions for you...
^Do these people know you're a werewolf?
^What happens if you find out a vampire was guilty of something?
^And if it turns out Heather is not involved
^What's your deal? How come you're a werewolf?
^Ok, I'm ready to talk about Heather...

c-0: ^Of course not. They just think I'm some sort of paranormal investigator. Humans think they can handle these things, but they can't. It would be stupid and dangerous to just out myself to every client.
c-1: ^You think I'm going to turn one your people in, huh? That's fair. I do not wish to expose supernatural beings to the world. Or take it upon myself to serve out punishment. I only want to give these parents some closure. And get paid.

^We live by different rules than them... Vampires must hurt others in order to survive, it's how things go. I too am not exempt from losing control, doing harm to humans. So I will not hold your people to moral standards I don't wish to be held to.
^Let's first focus on figuring out what happened.
c-2: ^I won't abandon you. You have my word. The deal is: we help each other out. I need an in with the vampires to figure my case out, you need to help finding out what happened to your girlfriend.
c-3: ^I could ask you the same. How come you're a vampire?
^You don't have to answer, let's just agree we're not here to share personal stories. I will extend you the same courtesy.... Unless it has something to do with the investigation, of course.
^Besides, we've only just met! We will get to know each other by working together, and it probably won't involve some sad origin story. I, at least, am more than that.

c-0: ^We share the apartment upstairs. I went to bed at around 4 am, she wasn't there. Then I woke up during the evening because I heard thought I heard her come in, but the was no one else around. I went back to sleep, then when I actually woke up it was night already and the place was a mess.

s: ^Just some things were out of place.

c-1: ^There were clothes all over the floor and the suitcase was missing, like she packed in a hurry.
^But what gets me more is how she took all these clothes and stuff and left behind some things that are really meaningful to her.

c-2: ^Not "see you in a week!" to me or anyone else.

g-3: ^Unless someone is lying, and you're the only one who she didn't say goodbye to.
g-4: ^But from what you're telling me I think we can rule out, for now, kidnapping or anything like that.
^Undeniably, something happened that made her want to leave. Or forced her to.
^Before we get around to talking to the others I wanna hear from you.

c-4: ^She liked being around people... And everyone just naturally gravitated towards her. You could instantly tell she was very sure of herself, didn't care what anyone thought. Heather never had any problem taking risks.
c-5: ^Heather likes to live in the present, but she doesn't usually think about the consequences of her actions. Sometimes it could come off as being a little self centered, to be honest. She was difficult to deal with sometimes, and could get very temperamental.

g-5: ^She was always like that, even before she got turned into a vampire.
^After that... You could say things got a bit more tense. It's always a difficult process do adapt to this other... way of living. Some do it better than others.
^How was the relationship between you two like?
g-6: ^I mean, as normal as a relationship between two vampires can be.
^Again, I feel like the others could tell you more, but she was a bit distant these past few weeks.
^And I'm not one to... If she need her space I won't press things.
^We're vampires. We have all the time in the world.
^Oh well, something tells me you're not telling me everything yet, but that's normal.
^We can go ahead and talk to the others, Jo, the drummer, the bartender...

s: ^Maybe I should go by myself first.

g-7: ^Hm... Listen, I know our partnership going to require a lot of trust, but this is asking a lot.
^This is my job, I can't get all of my info from you, I need to hear it directly from them so I can have my own impressions.
^You're also still technically a suspect too, wheter you like it or not.
^Seems like there's not much a choice then.
